Please check the videos if you feel like it. > I don't know how to share videos when I report issues,so I uploaded them to google drive. > Video1 shows when adguard disabled and Video2 shows adguard enabled. comment.body:
Текущие фильтры не полностью решают проблему с баннерами на главной странице. Блокировка затрагивает только изображения в рекламном блоке, но сам контейнер остаётся видимым, что приводит к отображению пустого пространства и остатков блока. Проблема не требует авторизации ### Фильтры, применённые в данный момент ``` podarkus.ru##+js(json-prune, data.Banners_Types) ||static.ohmywishes.com/images/banner-image/ ohmywishes.com##a[style*='url("https://static.ohmywishes.com/images/banner-image/'] ohmywishes.com##+js(json-prune, item.banners) ```
Скриншот
### Мой временное решение встроенными средствами uBlock Origin ``` ohmywishes.com##.dWXsbt.sc-jnOGJG ```
Скриншот

comment.body:
I used Chrome. On Firefox, it just keeps redirecting to the app, there's no options for me to choose staying at browser.

You can try testing this rule, but since it just redirects me to the outside app constantly, I can't do anything further:

```adb
||cupid.iqiyi.com/mixer?$redirect=noopjs
```

issue.title: pornhub.com

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [NSFW] [http://pornhub.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fpornhub.com) ### Comment > AdGuard DNS Parental Control works as expected over **Wi-Fi**, but fails to filter any content on **cellular data**. > > ## Steps to Reproduce > 1. Install the **AdGuard iOS app** and activate the custom DNS server, or install the **AdGuard DNS profile** on iOS. > 2. Connect to Wi-Fi and verify that blocking and safe search are working. > 3. Switch to **cellular data** and test again — content is not filtered. > *(Other AdGuard DNS rules and features still work regularly.)* > > ## Expected Behavior > Parental control features — **site blocking**, **safe search**, **YouTube restricted mode**, and **hidden comments** — should function over both **Wi-Fi and cellular**. > > ## Actual Behavior > On cellular, **adult content is not blocked** and **safe search is disabled**. > > ## Environment > - Device: *iPhone (iOS 17+)* > - DNS Profile: *Personal Private AdGuard DNS* > > ## Notes > - Tested across multiple devices: *Windows, macOS, iOS, Android, Apple TV* > - Tried various server configurations, including default with only **Parental Control** enabled > - Parental Control fails on **cellular data**, including for devices connected via **hotspot** > - [AdGuard DNS test](https://adguard.com/en/test.html) passes on cellular > - Tested with both **native iOS DNS** and **AdGuard DNS app** implementation > - The screenshot showing AdGuard DNS disabled was taken while connected to **Wi-Fi** > - The screenshot showing AdGuard DNS enabled was taken while using **cellular data** ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ht2mlc9zw0840ko84cok8ogw4gs00s05znlb30c9nw.png?nc=1) [Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/2wdou2dkixa8k8c8w4kkc0okg8koc0g2d28y8pko2z.jpg?nc=1) [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/qbhrhb853hck0oc0k4g0k0w484g84ckhao7bgs7dfk.png?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS DNS setup: | iPhone 12 Pro running AdGuard DNS Parental Control DNS server: | Private AdGuard DNS server System version: | iOS 18.5 Browser: | Safari Blocklists: | General:

labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://item.rakuten.co.jp/asus-store/a940w8h/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fitem.rakuten.co.jp%2Fasus-store%2Fa940w8h%2F) ### Comment > When I search or view products on rakuten,the site doesn't respond or often crashes and takes longer to display products. > > I tried to find out how to reproduce crashing website and noticed that it might be easier to reproduce by using Private Browsing(safari) in my end. > > I reported this issue to support adguard and got advice that try to reinstall adguard. After doing that this issue occurred again so I recorded videos that shows this issue. Please check the videos if you feel like it. > I don't know how to share videos when I report issues,so I uploaded them to google drive. > Video1 shows when adguard disabled and Video2 shows adguard enabled. I did the same operation in scrolling as possible. > > Video1 url:https://drive.google.com/file/d/1SZGyIWTBP8F3f-cCFUHxLHWuhygHCGTi/view?usp=drivesdk > > Video2 url: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kkjTneV3Y5dA9L117GTCagsYzwz9iQFv/view?usp=drivesdk > ### Screenshots

Not reproduced on my end.
Try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

filters/2_without_easylist.txt - Version: 2.3.83.72

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.izarc.org/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. When this exact **AdGuard filter - Ads** filter is activated - https://filters.adtidy.org/extension/ublock/filters/2_without_easylist.txt on this site: https://www.izarc.org/ this message appears:
```
Ad Blocker Detected!
It looks like you're using an ad blocker.
Our website relies on advertising to fund its content.

Please consider disabling your ad blocker
for our site or adding us to your allowlist.

Thank you!"
```

2. Screenshots

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd863c1f-7f4b-4095-a58e-5911c25d4bc7)

When this **AdGuard filter - Ads** - https://filters.adtidy.org/extension/ublock/filters/2_without_easylist.txt is disabled - the annoying message I quoted in my previous sentence does not appear on the site https://www.izarc.org/.


I am using Chromium v.136.0.7103.114.

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://forums.digitalspy.com/categories/broadcasting](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforums.digitalspy.com%2Fcategories%2Fbroadcasting) ### Comment > Sometimes when loading web pages on this site I get a plain blank page as in the first image. Reloading the page has the same effect that it may reveal the page or another blank white page. No other website does this. This only started happening yesterday after updating AdGuard for Safari in the Mac App Store to version 1.11.22. I had previously been on version 1.11.20 and this had never happened previously. I use the default configuration of AdGuard and have no changed any filter settings, I have not added any filters or custom rules. ### Screenshots

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection Other extensions used: | I have no other Safari extensions

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

Известно, что эта проблема решается с помощью AdGuard Extra.

Если вы пользуетесь AdGuard на устройствах Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включена в настройках приложения.

Если вы используете расширение AdGuard для браузера, рекомендуется также установить AdGuard Extra.

* [Установка на браузеры Chrome, Edge или другие, основанные на Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установка на Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

Yep, possible with update available in about 3-4 hours in cookies filter
If you use Chrome MV3 you have to wait for new version of extension (alternatively copy the rule from the commit to user filter).

If you are on free iOS or Android content blockerit is not possible as both products do not support required syntax.
